title: MIT Traditional Health Plan
cleaned_text: The MIT Traditional Health Plan is a comprehensive plan designed around the services provided by MIT Medical in Cambridge and Lexington. The plan offers convenient access to a broad range of MIT Medical services and specialties delivered by staff of more than 100 physicians, psychologists, nurses, social workers, and other health care professionals at our on-campus location. What You Should Know - You and any family members covered under your plan [choose a primary care provider](/benefits/health/plans)at MIT Medical. That primary care provider—or PCP—will coordinate your medical care and provide referrals as needed. - You should review the [plan rates](https://hr.mit.edu/benefits/health/plans/rates). - You will be charged a $10 copayment for most visits to a healthcare provider. - You must obtain a referral from your PCP for visits to most healthcare providers. - You can avoid the $50 copayment for high-tech imaging such as a CT scan, MRI, or PET, at [Shields MRI](http://www.shields.com/)with a referral from your PCP. If you visit any other provider for these tests, you will be required to pay the $50 high-tech imaging copay. - Review the MIT Traditional Plan Summary of Benefits (available [below](#forms)) For a list of providers and services offered at MIT Medical, please visit their [website](https://medical.mit.edu/my-mit/campus-employees). Need Help or Have Questions? Visit our [Health Plans overview](/benefits/health/plans) for information on eligibility, enrollment, choosing a PCP, mental health and other services, and more.
